title: Champions Liverpool travel to Chelsea, West Ham v Spurs and WSL Manchester derby – live
snippets:
• Writer Q&A, fan views, plus the latest news and previews
  • Today’s fixtures | Latest tables | And email matchday live

Chelsea wrapped up the WSL title, their sixth in a row, with a 1-0 win at Manchester United on Wednesday. Now United must bounce back to hold off local rivals Manchester City and secure European football next season. Tom Garry previews Sunday’s big WSL clash…

Skinner’s side also have a chance to do something United’s women have never done: complete a league double over City, having won 4-2 at the Etihad Stadium in January, and beat them at Old Trafford for the first time. A victory would mark the women’s team’s greatest Old Trafford moment. United’s record against City, though, leaves a lot to be desired. City have lost only two of 10 WSL Manchester derbies and they have been buoyed by the return in last Sunday’s 1-0 win at Leicester of England’s Lauren Hemp and Alex Greenwood for their first appearances of 2025.

Joelinton, Guimarães and Tonali have always bonded well off the pitch but, until they swapped stations, it looked as if the latter pair might not be able to play together. Now their on-field chemistry is almost palpable. “The balance of the team is hugely important,” said Newcastle’s manager, whose side have won 20 of their past 26 matches in all competitions. “That helped us find a better balance.”

Continue reading...
titles: Champions Liverpool travel to Chelsea, West Ham v Spurs and WSL Manchester derby – live
summary: Chelsea secured their sixth consecutive WSL title with a 1-0 victory over Manchester United, intensifying United's need to outperform Manchester City for a spot in European football. United aims to achieve a league double over City after a previous 4-2 win, a feat not yet accomplished by their women's team. Meanwhile, Manchester City, with only two losses in 10 WSL derbies against United, sees the return of key players Lauren Hemp and Alex Greenwood. In other news, Newcastle's improved team dynamics, highlighted by the synergy between Joelinton, Guimarães, and Tonali, have contributed to their
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the current state of various football teams and their strategies. It gives a deeper understanding of the dynamics and performance of the teams, which could be useful for fans or those interested in football. However, it does not report on solutions, improvements, or innovations, and its awareness is mainly limited to the football industry.

title: Australian federal election 2025 live: Coalition licks wounds after Peter Dutton loses seat in Labor election thrashing – latest Australia news and updates
snippets:
Labor is set to govern with a huge majority after the Coalition vote collapsed and Peter Dutton lost his seat of Dickson. Follow today’s news and the latest results

  • Election 2025 results LIVE: Australia votes tracker and federal seat counts
  • Anthony Albanese secures ‘win for the ages’ for Labor at federal election
  • Glum and glummer: Liberal faithful reel as Peter Dutton loses seat of Dickson after 24 years
  • Full coverage of the Australian election
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Littleproud on Labor: ‘They’re a slick machine’

Finally, David Littleproud is asked about what impact Donald Trump had on the outcome after Labor sought to tie Peter Dutton to the US president throughout the campaign.

What Anthony Albanese and the Labor team were able to was to really tap into these sorts of issues and then paint a bigger picture and destroy his character.

I think there’s a lesson in how they (Labor) did politics. They did it a lot better than us, and you’ve got to acknowledge that they’re a slick machine.

I think it’s part of the contagion of the way in which American politics has infused its way in to Australian politics, but very few people would have seen this coming and would have seen it coming certainly to the extent that it has happened.

My own view is that it’s an awful influence on Australian politics and something that we would do well to repudiate. Notwithstanding, you know the strength and the warmth and the importance of the relationship with the United States, in my opinion, Donald Trump does not have a role in relation to Australian domestic politics and we would do well to make that clear.

Continue reading...

titles: Australian federal election 2025 live: Coalition licks wounds after Peter Dutton loses seat in Labor election thrashing – latest Australia news and updates
Australian federal election 2025 live: Coalition licks wounds after Peter Dutton loses seat in Labor election thrashing – latest Australia news and updates
summary: Labor has won a significant victory in the 2025 Australian federal election, securing a large majority as the Coalition's vote dramatically decreased. Peter Dutton, a key figure in the Coalition, lost his seat of Dickson, a position he held for 24 years. Anthony Albanese's successful campaign for Labor was noted for its effectiveness, with David Littleproud acknowledging Labor's superior political strategy. The election also highlighted concerns about the influence of American politics, particularly the role of Donald Trump, on Australian political dynamics.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides a clear and comprehensive overview of the Australian federal election results, highlighting the key figures and strategies involved. It gives the reader actionable insights and a deeper understanding of the political dynamics in Australia. The story also raises awareness about the influence of American politics on Australian political dynamics, contributing to a sense of progress and empowering knowledge.

title: Clive Palmer’s Trumpet of Patriots fails to pick up single lower house seat despite text spam and ad blitz
snippets:
Minor party will not win a House of Representatives seat and its performance in the Senate is still unknown after spending millions on advertising

  • See our full coverage of the Australian election
  • Get our breaking news email,free app or daily news podcast

What does spending tens of millions of dollars on advertising and bombarding people with unsolicited text messages get you? Nothing, if you’re Clive Palmer – at least in the House of Representatives.

Trumpet of Patriots, Palmer’s most recent political party, will not win a single lower house seat and, as of midday on Saturday, had only 1.85% of the national vote. Legalise Cannabis Australia, which spent just $6,200 on social media ads in the last 30 days and barely campaigned, has so far won 1.14% of the vote.

Sign up for the Afternoon Update: Election 2025 email newsletter

Continue reading...

titles: Clive Palmer’s Trumpet of Patriots fails to pick up single lower house seat despite text spam and ad blitz
Clive Palmer’s Trumpet of Patriots fails to pick up single lower house seat despite text spam and ad blitz
summary: Clive Palmer's political party, Trumpet of Patriots, failed to secure a single House of Representatives seat in the Australian election despite spending millions on advertising and sending unsolicited text messages. As of midday on Saturday, the party had garnered only 1.85% of the national vote. In contrast, Legalise Cannabis Australia, which spent just $6,200 on social media ads and barely campaigned, received 1.14% of the vote. The performance of Trumpet of Patriots in the Senate remains unclear.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful information about the performance of different political parties in the Australian election, including their campaign strategies and expenditures. However, it does not delve into the reasons for the results or the implications for future elections.

title: New Treatment Repairs Gut and Tames Aging Cells
snippets: ADAM19 appears to play a significant role in reducing the inflammatory response associated with intestinal damage and cellular senescence. titles: New Treatment Repairs Gut and Tames Aging Cells
summary: Researchers at the Buck Institute for Research on Aging, led by Sudipta Bar, Amit Sharma, and Pankaj Kapahi, have discovered that the enzyme ADAM19 significantly reduces inflammation linked to intestinal damage and cellular aging. This finding suggests a potential new treatment for mitigating the effects of aging at the cellular level.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a new scientific discovery that could potentially lead to a new treatment for aging. It gives readers an understanding of the role of the enzyme ADAM19 in reducing inflammation and cellular aging, thus offering actionable insights for those interested in the topic of aging.

title: New Obesity Drugs Defy Logic – And Succeed
snippets: Drugs that both activate and block the GIP receptor reduce weight through different brain mechanisms, offering a new direction for targeted obesity treatments. Drugs that target the receptors for the hormones GLP-1 (glucagon-like peptide-1) and GIP (glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide) have proven effective in treating obesity and type 2 diabetes. While GLP-1 and GIP receptor agonists [...]
titles: New Obesity Drugs Defy Logic – And Succeed
summary: Recent advancements in obesity treatment have shown that drugs targeting the GIP receptor, capable of both activating and blocking it, can effectively reduce weight via distinct brain mechanisms. This breakthrough provides a promising new approach for creating targeted obesity treatments, complementing existing therapies that involve GLP-1 and GIP receptor agonists. These drugs have already demonstrated significant efficacy in managing obesity and type 2 diabetes, marking a notable progress in medical approaches to these conditions.
constructiveness_reason: The story is highly constructive as it reports on progress in obesity treatment. It provides useful information about new drugs targeting the GIP receptor and their efficacy in managing obesity and type 2 diabetes. This could potentially empower readers who are dealing with these conditions or those interested in the field.
